# FILE FORMATS 
![](https://plus.unsplash.com/premium_vector-1724652487429-69bcd389b930?q=80&w=1480&auto=format&fit=crop&ixlib=rb-4.1.0&ixid=M3wxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8fA%3D%3D){width="50%"}

##  
:::: {.columns}

::: {.column}
-  The structure or way data is organized and encoded within a computer file, dictating how applications should interpret and display its contents.

- File format affects the size, quality, and compatibility with different software

- These formats determine a file's characteristics, such as how text is stored in a Word document (like `.docx`) or how images are encoded in a file (like `.jpg`)

- To recognize a file format, you can identify it with its `file extension`.
:::

::: {.column}
![](images/formats.png){.img width="80%" fig-align="center"}
:::

::::


## File Extensions {background-image="images/file-types-2.png.png" background-size="50%"}

- file extension is the suffix at the end of a file's name.
- They usually appear after the `dot` or `period` in a file's name.
